intro: Serenoa repens, commonly known as saw palmetto, is a small evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its fan-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers that develop into red, fleshy berries. The plant thrives in sandy soils and is often found in coastal dunes and pine flatwoods. Its berries are an important food source for various wildlife species. Botanically, it belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms.
